priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Tumor and Lesion Identification Result Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96780

self.title: CDISC SDTM Tumor and Lesion Identification Result Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to tumor and lesion identification results.
name: Tumor and Lesion Identification Results
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Tumor and Lesion Identification Result Terminology

terms.definition: For neoplasms, a non-infiltrating and non-metastasizing neoplastic process that is characterized by the absence of morphologic features associated with malignancy (e.g., severe atypia, nuclear pleomorphism, tumor cell necrosis, and abnormal mitoses). For other conditions, a process that is mild in nature and not dangerous to health. (NCI)
The identification of a tumor, lesion, or site of disease that is present at baseline and will be quantifiably measured.
The identification of a tumor, lesion, or site of disease which has not been previously seen or characterized.
The identification of a tumor, lesion, or site of disease that is incapable of being measured at baseline.

The identification of a tumor, lesion or site of disease that is present at baseline and not considered a target, but may be part of the objective assessment of the response to the therapeutic intervention.
The identification of a tumor, lesion, or site of disease that is present at baseline and will not be quantifiably measured.
The identification of a tumor, lesion, or site of disease that is present at baseline and is the target of the therapeutic intervention.
The identification of a tumor or lesion that is present at baseline, located outside of or independent of any lymph nodes, and is the target of the therapeutic intervention.
The identification of a tumor or lesion located at or near the lymph node that is present at baseline and is the target of the therapeutic intervention.
The identification of a nodule that is the target of the therapeutic intervention.
